Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk quota
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: quota bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The quota packages contain a suite of system administration tools for monitoring and limiting user and group disk usage on file systems. This update fixes the following bug: After upgrading the nfs-utils packages, the nfs-rquotad.service systemd service was previously unavailable on the system after starting the quota remote procedure call (RPC) service. With this update, the quota packages include a new rpc-rquotad.service systemd service, which allows querying and setting disk quotas over a network. Now, rpc-rquotad.service can be configured in the /etc/sysconfig/rpc-rquotad file. The nfs-rquotad service alias is also provided for compatibility with earlier versions. As a result, the quota RPC service is now available on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. (BZ#1316440) Users of quota are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
